bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: Territory of Washington United States Vs Franscois Lafontaisis
In the District Court for the 1st judicial district of Washington Territory, holding terms at Walla Walla in said district at May Term A.D. 1874

At the regular Term of the District Court for the First Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Walla Walla in and for the counties of Walla Walla and Whitman begun and held at Walla Walla aforesaid, on the eleventh day of May A.D. 1874, it being the second Monday of said month, and the day appointed by law for the holding of said Court: The Grand Jurors of the United States, of America good and lawful men of the District aforesaid, composed of the counties aforesaid, then and there duly elected, empanneled, sworn and charged, on the part of the United States, of America to inquire within, and for the body of the District aforesaid, of all offences against the laws of the United States, of America on their oaths do present that Franscois Lafontaisis () late of the District aforesaid, at Walla Walla aforesaid, and within the jurisdiction of the Court on the fourth day of March A.D. 1874, did sell, exchange, give, barter and dispose of spiritous liquors to an indian named Nee Shone, said Indian then and then being under the charge of an Indian agent appointed by the United States of America contrary to the form of the Statute in such cases made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America
Witness sworn before the Grand Jury
A. Seitel Sworn Nee Shone Indian Sworn Joe Bentley Sworn
SC Wingard US attorney for Wash. Ter.
